type.description: ssl certificate type, server to server certificate, client to client certificate for upstream

status.description: ssl status, 1 to enable, 0 to disable

items.description: uri regular expression to skip mtls

filter.description: logger filter rules

scheme.description: The scheme of the upstream. For L7 proxy, it can be one of grpc/grpcs/http/https. For L4 proxy, it can be one of tcp/tls/udp. For specific protocols, it can be kafka.

priority.description: priority of node

verify.description: Turn on server certificate verification, currently only kafka upstream is supported

key.description: the key of chash for dynamic load balancing

status.description: route status, 1 to enable, 0 to disable

expose_headers.description: multiple header use ',' to split.If not specified, no custom headers are exposed.

max_age.description: maximum number of seconds the results can be cached.-1 means no cached, the max value is depend on browser,more details plz check MDN. default: 5.

timing_allow_origins_by_regex.description: you can use regex to allow specific origins which can view timing information,for example use [.*\.test.com] to allow a.test.com and b.test.com

allow_credential.description: allow client append credential. according to CORS specification,if you set this option to 'true', you can not use '*' for other options.

allow_origins_by_regex.description: you can use regex to allow specific origins when no credentials,for example use [.*\.test.com$] to allow a.test.com and b.test.com

allow_methods.description: you can use '*' to allow all methods when no credentials,'**' to allow forcefully(it will bring some security risks, be carefully),multiple method use ',' to split. default: *.

priority.description: priority of plugins by customized order

filter.description: filter determines whether the plugin needs to be executed at runtime

allow_origins_by_metadata.description: set allowed origins by referencing origins in plugin metadata

allow_headers.description: you can use '*' to allow all header when no credentials,'**' to allow forcefully(it will bring some security risks, be carefully),multiple header use ',' to split. default: *.

timing_allow_origins.description: you can use '*' to allow all origins which can view timing information when no credentials,'**' to allow forcefully (it will bring some security risks, be careful),multiple origin use ',' to split. default: nil

allow_origins.description: you can use '*' to allow all origins when no credentials,'**' to allow forcefully(it will bring some security risks, be carefully),multiple origin use ',' to split. default: *.

schema.$comment: this is a mark for our injected plugin schema

authorization_params.description: Extra authorization params to the authorize endpoint

client_rsa_private_key.description: Client RSA private key used to sign JWT.

client_rsa_private_key_id.description: Client RSA private key ID used to compute a signed JWT.

renew_access_token_on_expiry.description: Whether to attempt silently renewing the access token.

access_token_expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access token in seconds if expires_in is not present.

refresh_session_interval.description: Time interval to refresh user ID token without re-authentication.

iat_slack.description: Tolerance of clock skew in seconds with the iat claim in an ID token.

proxy_opts.description: HTTP proxy server be used to access identity server.

no_proxy.description: Comma separated list of hosts that should not be proxied.

accept_none_alg.description: Set to true if the OpenID provider does not sign its ID token.

accept_unsupported_alg.description: Ignore ID token signature to accept unsupported signature algorithm.

force_reauthorize.description: Whether to execute the authorization flow when a token has been cached.

revoke_tokens_on_logout.description: Notify authorization server a previous token is no longer needed.

jwk_expires_in.description: Expiration time for JWK cache in seconds.

redirect_uri.description: auto append '.apisix/redirect' to ngx.var.uri if not configured

post_logout_redirect_uri.description: the URI will be redirect when request logout_path

unauth_action.description: The action performed when client is not authorized. Use auth to redirect user to identity provider, deny to respond with 401 Unauthorized, and pass to allow the request regardless.

required_scopes.description: List of scopes that are required to be granted to the access token

use_pkce.description: when set to true the PKEC(Proof Key for Code Exchange) will be used.

set_access_token_header.description: Whether the access token should be added as a header to the request for downstream

access_token_in_authorization_header.description: Whether the access token should be added in the Authorization header as opposed to the X-Access-Token header.

set_id_token_header.description: Whether the ID token should be added in the X-ID-Token header to the request for downstream.

priority.description: priority of plugins by customized order

filter.description: filter determines whether the plugin needs to be executed at runtime

introspection_expiry_claim.description: Name of the expiry claim that controls the cached access token TTL.

set_userinfo_header.description: Whether the user info token should be added in the X-Userinfo header to the request for downstream.

introspection_interval.description: TTL of the cached and introspected access token in seconds.

cache_segment.description: Name of a cache segment to differentiate caches.

set_refresh_token_header.description: Whether the refresh token should be added in the X-Refresh-Token header to the request for downstream.

jwt_verification_cache_ignore.description: Whether to ignore cached verification and re-verify.

use_nonce.description: Whether to include nonce parameter in authorization request.

access_token_expires_leeway.description: Expiration leeway in seconds for access token renewal.

lifetime.description: it holds the cookie lifetime in seconds in the future

secret.description: the key used for the encrypt and HMAC calculation

client_jwt_assertion_expires_in.description: Life duration of the signed JWT in seconds.
